channel.title: How do I make monsters drop items? [PI]
channel.description: Heres a line of code i typed in to try and add drops to this particular monster: [code]#bouncer 4278:100 275:37 995:100 4278:100 4278:100 4278:100 4278:100[/code] Anyways I put in that code closed the file and restarted my server(knowing that the kind of file i was editing does not need to be compiled). I went to go test the drops and the monster still dropped nothing. But when it did drop something. It was something that was not on my list, i.e a charm or something. And also I took a look at some of the other monster drops and here is an example of what I saw: [code]#sergeant strongstack 6261:150 995:20000 808:129 886:127 391:2 207:2 3051:2 213:2 11710:1 11712:1 11714:1 11724:1 11726:1 11728:1 989:1[/code] Now how does that work? The code i showed above looks to me like it goes like item:amount, and not item:drop percentage. Am I doing the code wrong or something? I'm just completely baffled here.

item.title: How do I make monsters drop items? [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Camballer Camballer
item.description:
@Camballer wrote:

Hmm pm me I can tv you.

item.title: How do I make monsters drop items? [PI]
item.dc:creator: @sex-scape_owner sex-scape owner
item.description:
@sex-scape_owner wrote:

next to the monster id eg 1:25 means every 25 drops you get one of the items listed here change to 1 if u want it to be dropped all the time

compile to be sure i had the same problem until i compiled…

Read full topic
item.source: How do I make monsters drop items? [PI]

item.title: How do I make monsters drop items? [PI]
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

It’s a common issue with PI, the item codes in item.cfg aren’t always completely right… Believe me, I was trying to make men drop runes, and instead they dropped visages… Just move the item code on the drop +1 or +2 or -1 or -2

Read full topic

item.title: How do I make monsters drop items? [PI]
item.dc:creator: @tztk tztk
item.description:
@tztk wrote:

Heres a line of code i typed in to try and add drops to this particular monster:

#bouncer 4278:100 275:37 995:100 4278:100 4278:100 4278:100 4278:100
Anyways I put in that code closed the file and restarted my server(knowing that the kind of file i was editing does not need to be compiled). I went to go test the drops and the monster still dropped nothing. But when it did drop something. It was something that was not on my list, i.e a charm or something. And also I took a look at some of the other monster drops and here is an example of what I saw:

#sergeant strongstack 6261:150 995:20000 808:129 886:127 391:2 207:2 3051:2 213:2 11710:1 11712:1 11714:1 11724:1 11726:1 11728:1 989:1
Now how does that work? The code i showed above looks to me like it goes like item:amount, and not item:drop percentage. Am I doing the code wrong or something? I’m just completely baffled here.

Read full topic
